newsitem.title: GERMANY: Hundreds gather for Fiszman funeral in Frankfurt.
newsitem.headline: Hundreds gather for Fiszman funeral in Frankfurt.

text.p: More than 300 mourners gathered at a Jewish cemetery in Frankfurt on Tuesday to bury Jakub Fiszman, a 40-year-old businessman kidnapped and brutally murdered in a case that shook Germany.

Fiszman's badly beaten body was found in dense woodlands north of Frankfurt on Saturday. He was abducted on October 1 and despite the payment of a four million mark ($2.61 million) ransom, was killed on October 4, police said.
Leaders of Germany's vestigial Jewish community attended the closely guarded ceremony, held in Hebrew and in German. After the burial, the mourners marched silently into Frankfurt's city centre.
Georg Fiszman, the victim's brother who had paid four million marks in ransom to the kidnappers, said Jakub Fiszman was a generous man. His family was still numbed by the murder.
Ignatz Bubis, the leader of the central council of Jews in Germany, was at the funeral, which attracted national media coverage.
Speakers at the ceremony said the Jewish community was speechless at the brutality of Jakub Fiszman's abductors.
Outside the graveyard, security guards in bullet-proof vests watched over the proceedings.
Police are holding Rainer Koerppen, 48, and his son Sven, 26, in connection with Fiszman's abduction and murder, and a third man is still being sought.
While Sven has admitted he took part in the kidnapping, both men deny murdering Fiszman. ($1=1.5323 Mark)
